# text

**Instance Property**

The text that the text field displays.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var text: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Assigning a new value to this property also replaces the value of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/attributedText] property with the same text, albeit without any inherent style attributes. Instead the text view styles the new string using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/font], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/textColor], and other style-related properties of the class.

This value is `nil` by default.

## Configuring the text attributes

- **attributedText**: The styled text that the text field displays.
- **placeholder**: The string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **attributedPlaceholder**: The styled string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **defaultTextAttributes**: The default attributes to apply to the text.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textColor**: The color of the text.
- **textAlignment**: The technique for aligning the text.
- **typingAttributes**: The attributes to apply to new text that the user enters.
- **UITextField.BorderStyle**: The type of border around the text field.
